# Pull Request

<!--
IMPORTANT: PR Title MUST follow Conventional Commits format:
  type(scope): description

Examples:
  ✓ feat(backend): add user authentication service
  ✓ fix(frontend): resolve map rendering issue
  ✓ chore(deps): update dependencies
  ✗ Bugfix/solve issue (INVALID - will be rejected)
  ✗ Add new feature (INVALID - missing type)

Available types: feat, fix, refactor, docs, test, chore, style, perf, ci, build, revert
Available scopes: deps, backend, frontend, application, domain, infrastructure, ci, release
Scope is optional but recommended.
-->

## Description

<!-- Provide a clear and concise description of what this PR does -->

## Type of Change

<!-- Mark the relevant option with an 'x' -->

- [ ] `feat` - New feature
- [ ] `fix` - Bug fix
- [ ] `refactor` - Code restructuring without behavior change
- [ ] `docs` - Documentation update
- [ ] `test` - Test updates
- [ ] `chore` - Maintenance (deps, configs, etc)
- [ ] `style` - Code style (formatting, linting)
- [ ] `perf` - Performance improvement
- [ ] `ci` - CI/CD changes
- [ ] `build` - Build system changes

## Scope

<!-- What area of the codebase does this affect? -->

- [ ] `backend` - Backend application
- [ ] `frontend` - Frontend application
- [ ] `application` - Application layer (use cases)
- [ ] `domain` - Domain layer (entities, value objects)
- [ ] `infrastructure` - Infrastructure layer (adapters)
- [ ] `ci` - CI/CD workflows
- [ ] `deps` - Dependencies
- [ ] Other: _______________

- [ ] Build succeeds (`pnpm build`)

## Checklist

- [ ] My PR title follows [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/) format
- [ ] My code follows the project's Clean Architecture principles (see `CLAUDE.md`)
- [ ] I have updated relevant documentation
- [ ] I have added/updated tests where appropriate
